website_summaries.verdict: The adequate sound levels and clear bass reproduction in this compact unit make it a good option to get big sound in average or smaller-sized living rooms.
pros: The 115 decibel maximum output of this unit is enough to fill a smaller living room, and the 22 Hz low-frequency capability will capture all but the lowest-frequency sounds or notes
The clarity of those sounds is a highlight of this model, as they are reproduced with no noticeable distortion at high volumes
The unit is a lightweight 27 pounds and compact enough to fit in almost any room, even those where space is a challenge
cons: Users who want high volumes in larger spaces may prefer a slightly more powerful unit

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This is my first sealed subwoofer and I think I'm set on them. Ported ones always have bloomy mid-bass for the BIG BOOM effect, but this sealed compact 12" subwoofer (yes it's both compact and 12") is much more controlled and has much more noticeable sub-bass. My previous $120 subwoofers cannot deliver the sub-bass, and of course not the clarity of this one. You haven't heard sub-bass until you've tried a subwoofer like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rhamnetin

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend this sub enough
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this sub around 6 months ago having never had a true subwoofer. I use this for music, movies, and gaming - performs well across the board. I use this in a 30x20 room in my basement and it is more than adequate to push base through the entire room if needed. Can't recommend this sub enough. Anyone saying this sub is not loud or lacks base obviously do not have their DSP set up correctly - there are only a few of those reviews but wanted to reiterate that this sub is VERY powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I WOULD RECOMMEND IT TO A FRIEND OR FAMILY MEMBER
customer_reviews.text: This subwoofer packs a punch of very low bass frequency notes!!! It's in a sealed box with 300 watts of power to a 12" subwoofer. Overall, I love this subwoofer and I would recommend it to a friend or family member. The problem in my set up is the midrange speakers in the center channel. I have Orb Audio MOD2s as left, center, and right channel speakers. This subwoofer does NOT mate well with these Orb Audio speakers. There's not enough midrange frequency output. It's not the fault of this SVS subwoofer, so I give it a clear 5 stars. RECOMMENDED!!!
customer_reviews.author: JOSE A. DUARTE

customer_reviews.title: Great sound in a small package
customer_reviews.text: I have a limited space for a subwoofer and so my choices were limited. I replaced a 10" Polk audio subwoofer that produced 50 WRMS with this speaker. The sound is solid, tight and more than powerful enough for the rather small room I have my system in. The volume can be turned up quite loud without sounding "Booming". I think some of this is due to the fact that the sub is not ported. This affects the resonance at higher volumes, but it has enough power to overcome the lack of a port.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetGuy69

customer_reviews.title: Superb Sound, Once it Was Fixed
customer_reviews.text: An excellent subwoofer, but mine arrived with a defective amplifier. SVS was very cooperative and gave me the option of returning the whole sub (at their expense) or sending me a replacement amplifier (also at their expense) which was the option I chose. In talking to SVS, I got the impression this was not a rare occurrence.
customer_reviews.author: Napa Jack

customer_reviews.title: Bumpy little baby
customer_reviews.text: I moved into a new apartment and was very sad to discover my limited space for audio equipment. After much homework, I finally purchased this sub and I'm glad I die. While it won't out-perform the bigger audiophile subs, it definitely makes an effort. This little thing pumps out some decent volume with significant clarity. I was impressed at how clean the bass was when I started putting it through its paces. If you have space requirements and need a small sub, this one is well worth a purchase.
customer_reviews.author: William F.

customer_reviews.title: TOP QUALITY SOUND
customer_reviews.text: This sealed subwoofer replaces a larger subwoofer and has a better definition of the low frequencies than the substantially larger subwoofer that it replaced. It is sealed and not ported, which I believe adds to its great definition and realism of the low frequencies that it covers. It works very well with an AV system that is used mostly for TV and movies. Music on this system sounds far more natural than with the larger subwoofer that this small subwoofer replaced. Cicerosecundus
customer_reviews.author: Cicerosecundus

customer_reviews.title: No Bump.
customer_reviews.text: SVS is a good company. I have a 15 year old SVS 25-31 PCi Powered Subwoofer that is ported. It kicks ass. The SVS SB1000 does not. It can not keep up with a ported sub. Maybe because it's sealed, or maybe because I'm used to a ported sub, but it has to be turned up to 7 to match the ported SVS 25-31 PCi at 2 on the volume. Don't get me wrong, the SB1000 is OK, it just won't kick you in the chest unless it's wide open.
customer_reviews.author: Mary & Bobby

customer_reviews.title: This is the sub you want
customer_reviews.text: Let's see.... smaller cabinet, full-sized 12" speaker, tight bass, this unit does cover many bases. If you tuck the unit behind a piece of furniture or behind your desk, you will forget you even have a sub. Your speakers just sound ... good. Really good. I'm using this unit off a Cambridge Audio DACMagic 100, paired with Swan T200C's. One nifty feature is the sub has outputs as well, so if you have a DAC that only has RCA outs, you can run your speakers off the sub outputs.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Great sound.  Excellent warranty.
customer_reviews.text: This SVS subwoofer sounds great with a good pair of bookshelf speakers. I’m using Audioengine A5+ Wireless units for this purpose. Overall sound quality is outstanding, even in a reasonably large room. The SVS provides fairly good value for the money, especially if you can find a discounted “open-box” unit from one of the authorized dealers. The five-year warranty is an outstanding benefit of all SVS subwoofers.
customer_reviews.author: kelly londry

customer_reviews.title: Wow. I had no idea what I was missing
customer_reviews.text: The headline says it all. My TV setup is in a loft so it is quite open. Very rich low-end. ALL my UHD movies sound better. This combined with the older 100 W sub compliment each other beautifully. I wish I could afford all SVS speakers. Great first impression from the brand. Looks great and feels high quality.
customer_reviews.author: G. Adibhatla

customer_reviews.title: Way more than BOOM BOOM BOOM
customer_reviews.text: Any subwoofer that moves a lot of air can produce low frequencies at high volume. This SVS is much more than that. The low frequencies are detailed and tuned--clear pitch and timbre, not just thump thump thump. I use it to listen to music, especially classical and acoustic music, so clarity and detail are important to me. It is compact. I was using an older subwoofer with an 8" cone,. The SVS with more power and a 10" cone is almost the same size, just a little more than a cubic foot. My ears are happy.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Solid Sound Subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: After listening to the sub for two weeks I noticed the sounds were much better then first breaking in. Although it is not as punchy as some other woofers but the sounds are warm and able to fill in nicely with the main speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Swift

customer_reviews.title: Nice deep base!
customer_reviews.text: I know there are better more powerful subs out there but this does the job. My brother recommended this sub for my new setup in my living room and i love it. It has a kick, nice deep base for movies and with music. Also added a wireless transmitter by the same manufacturer which is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Cuevas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Soft Bass... And Plenty Of It.
customer_reviews.text: This speaker is very impressive indeed. Audiophile quality, wall rattling power. Don’t worry about having too little bass, unless you live in St Paul’s Cathedral. This will do just fine for most residences.
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: Hear Everything You’ve Been Missing
customer_reviews.text: This is truly an exceptional subwoofer, the proof is simply hearing what you’ve been missing using a sub standard device. What a difference this subwoofer makes! Simply Amazing. Fires down low and is clean sounding, but you can still feel the thump. I love this subwoofer. I want another one to complete my 5.2 experience.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound, nicely balanced and easy to setup. I took the legs off on the bottom and put it in a very small enclosure and it still sounds amazing. 5 year warranty is really cool too and during my setup, the SVS online chat folks were extremely responsive and helpful. I put this in a fairly large room and its more than adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: excellent for music, good value
customer_reviews.text: I use it for music, not movies. It is all I need for a medium-sized room, and I like electronica fairly loud. I have read that the PB version goes deeper and louder, but is also bigger and heavier and slightly "looser" sounding. All in all, I am completely satisfied with the SB-1000 for music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Sounding Quality Sub-woofer.
customer_reviews.text: This sub is being used with a Yamaha R-S 700 receiver and vintage Genesis 320 Floor-standing speakers. The sound for music and movies is now complete. The SVS site has a section that helps with the settings for the sub according to your speakers (Merlin). I was amazed that it had my vintage 1980's speakers listed. It suggests the SB 2000 with these speakers. However, I just used the same recommended settings for the SB 1000 and it sounds great. Watching a movie the lows make me jump sometimes just like at the theater. Not a rattling sound,just clean and powerful. . The were well packaged in a box w/styrofoam and inside a larger box. Arrived in perfect shape.
customer_reviews.author: CE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2.1 setup
customer_reviews.text: Bought through amazon warehouse, outer box was slightly damaged, insides were unopened and undamaged. Paired with a pair of Klipsch RP-250f's, sounds great once setup. Using a 2.1 channel amp with sub out, gain at 12 o'clock, LPF set to 60 hz. Sounds fine with TV, but priority is music and it delivers.
customer_reviews.author: R&J

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous sound
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old subwoofer with this SVS and am blown away by the richness of the sound. I really had forgotten how much I was missing in the music.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sub! The bass is very full with excellent sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! The build and sound quality exceeds the price!
customer_reviews.author: Darran L. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sub for music listening for small to medium rooms. It compliments my bookshelves perfectly. Put them on anti-vibration pads because its on the second floor. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hi-Fi systems...
customer_reviews.text: This rig backs my Klipsch Heresy IIIs with a lot of authority for its diminutive size. Very articulate and clean bass response. This unit is for reproducing accurate bass as the source was recorded, not artificially rattling your walls.
customer_reviews.author: James Allen Voels

customer_reviews.title: and I'm happy I did
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I'd spend $500 on a subwoofer, but here we are, and I'm happy I did. Great sound quality. I use it with my desktop setup in a pretty small room, so volume isn't an issue. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Superb subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: This subwoofer is excellent for both music and movies in my small/medium size room. Blends perfectly with my Polk Audio Monitor 50's.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Buffa

customer_reviews.title: Solid build, Great sound and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect sub for my system. Matched with my Yamaha Amp, Audio Technica Turntable and PSB Imagine T speakers in a small room setup. This sub really opened up my system, without overpowering my room. Recommend to anyone looking for a small, well built sub with great sound.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Draper

customer_reviews.title: Great music sub
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful, tight, tuneful sub. Measured output drops off rapidly below 30Hz in my 15'X30' room, so be mindful of that if you're considering a sub with very deep bass. I use this for 2 channel stereo so it's fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Subalicious
customer_reviews.text: SVS makes a great sub and this is just the bottom of the field, bass is deep and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzman1

customer_reviews.title: Love this sub.
customer_reviews.text: Was delivered promptly. It's a great looking sub and sounds perfect in the master bedroom where space is tight. Very pleased. I updated my review with a photo of the rear connections. Hope this helps some of you with questions.
customer_reviews.author: Tom in KY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sub
customer_reviews.text: Excellent addition to my 2 channel music rig. I bought it specifically for hifi music but it is more than adequate for AV as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bm7b5

customer_reviews.title: little giant
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. I was looking for the best small woofer I could find, and this is now the best component of my system. Its a little on the pricier side for entry level audiophile equipment, but the quality and output are incredible. If you want a small box with big sound, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: gd4447

customer_reviews.title: Will Rock your house down
customer_reviews.text: Extremely powerful, i live in an apartment and may have bought too much sub =). Can be subtle and chest punching. Great Sub!
customer_reviews.author: Jovane Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Bass the way it should be.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today, didn't waste any time setting it up. Setup was a breeze, it blends beautifully with my new Audioengine 5+ speakers. I run this on my computer sound system. Asus Strix Soar / ESS SABRE9006A DAC Texas Instruments OPA2134PAGA Sound Plus Hi Perf Aud Oper Amp Beyerdynamic DT 880 Prenium 250 ohm Headphones TONOR 3.5mm Professional Condenser Recording Podcast Microphone Audioengine A5+ Stereo Speakers 150 Watt Frequency response:50db 50Hz-22kHz ±1.5dB SVS SB-1000 – 12”, 300 Watt DSP Controlled, Sealed Box Subwoofer phase 11 o'clock volume 1 o'clock low pass 65 Hz Love it.beats the heck out of any computer sound I ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Bourgoin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good sub, i eventually went DIY but still kept this in another system.
customer_reviews.author: jpphun

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bass in a Small box
customer_reviews.text: Got 2 of these for my small home theater and they get the job done. Great sounding and deep bass.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Worm

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable bass. Very controlled and not over-done. Sound is great!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff F

customer_reviews.title: Great little subwoofer
customer_reviews.text: a lot of bass for the buck.im completely satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: robert d.

customer_reviews.title: SVS SB1000 compact subwoofer - Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Update 2020-05-15 I just purchased a second SVS SB-1000 subwoofer seven years after the first one, based on a combination of reasons: - Audioholics.com strong recommendation about the advantages of having dual identical subwoofers, instead of just one. - Very satisified with the first one in terms of performance, reliability, company reputation and reviews. - Competitive price. - I ordered from a SVS Authorized Dealer, through Amazon.com - Perfect combination of support and convenience. Original Review I bought it in April 2013 after reading several professional reviews online praising this compact and excellent sub-woofer. I have to agree with the experts. I am very satisfied with it. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: FLmiami

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the dimension in sound that this subwoofer produces. Great product. Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Craig F.

customer_reviews.title: Subsonic? Yes!
customer_reviews.text: This little subwoofer really delivers the LFE down to the subsonic. Easy to place with its small 13” footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Carter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition
customer_reviews.text: I bought this subwoofer for it's size and power. As most home system woofers get pretty bulky from 12" on up this one is an exception. The box is as small as you're gonna get on a 12" and it sounds great. I keep it a little past half way and it adds the perfect amount of bass for my music listening and movie watching. I'd recommend it to anyone trying to add a sleek woofer to their living room set up.
customer_reviews.author: Beau G

customer_reviews.title: It requires proper placement and good room acoustics to sound powerful however
customer_reviews.text: It's very detailed, accurate, and tight. It requires proper placement and good room acoustics to sound powerful however. If that's a concern of yours get the ported version, or two of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality and appearance of this subwoofer is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: I can only that this is by far the best subwoofer I have heard
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I now believe the hype. I'm not going to go into this long detailed review because there may others that have done it already. I can only that this is by far the best subwoofer I have heard. It works beautifully with both movies and music. It does better with music so if you are like me that listens to music all the time then this is the one. I replaced a Boston Acoustics subwoofer which still worked well but this SVS outperforms it in every which way.
customer_reviews.author: TYRONE FORBES

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the Bass, this model works nicely in my room that is 10 X 20. Great service and delivery
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again
customer_reviews.text: Has a very high quality feel to it and fills a small space quite easily without overpowerring the rest of the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Wahl

customer_reviews.title: Great little subwoofer...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my living room 'mini' home theater, 2.1 for blu-ray movies. It rattles pictures, doors, and windows when called upon. This sealed sub provides ample amounts of clean and tight LFE. Amazing value for a 27 pound sub. SVS sells amazing products, this is my third sub from them. Accept no substitutes: SVS. A+
customer_reviews.author: Walter Sobchak

customer_reviews.title: much larger sub and I am very pleased with my purchase and highly recommend this little sub ...
customer_reviews.text: Tickled with this rather diminutive sub. Hook-up was simple and the improvement was instantly evident. I put the Soundpath feet on and threw in a bass filled flick....Very impressive bass from the enclosure. It replaced an older, much larger sub and I am very pleased with my purchase and highly recommend this little sub that can.....Thanks...RB
customer_reviews.author: Rick Burnham

customer_reviews.title: just wonderful sound. I haven't had it break up or ...
customer_reviews.text: just wonderful sound. I haven't had it break up or been able to overdrive it yet.
customer_reviews.author: smoraneng

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: I can write what this sub has added too my system , it's what all the others have been saying you have to experience this for your self you will not be disappointed you will be amazed what this sub will add to the overall sound of hour system
customer_reviews.author: MANNIX 33

customer_reviews.title: svs sb1000
customer_reviews.text: very satisfied with this sub. I have it setup in a 2.1 system with my anthony gallo a'diva se speakers. The svs sub is tight and articulate and generates very little heat. Kudos to svs for making a very musical sub.
customer_reviews.author: jeloid

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding Sub-Woofer for music. I believe the best in its price range.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to shake your house off its foundation so go ...
customer_reviews.text: Marvelous subwoofer! Very easy to shake your house off its foundation so go easy on the volume setting on the back. I have it at about 1/3 and it rattled a china cabinet. Had to rearrange things. Also helps if you don't set the crossover frequency too high to avoid booming voices. This unit has the features and flexibility to optimize it for your setting. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment the output is very low on this sub even ...
customer_reviews.text: Huge disappointment the output is very low on this sub even with everything turned up, only good for a small office or bedroom. I have a medium sized living room and my Klipsch RP-250F tower speakers put out almost as much bass. If you have a normal sized living room this is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: The sound is absolutely amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in my retail store along with four JBL's. The sound is absolutely amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Chaim

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Polk PSW10 but this sub sounds worse. The bass is too boomy regardless of placement or EQ
customer_reviews.author: Harsh Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Truly Stunning
customer_reviews.text: SVS appears to have put quality and affordability ahead of sheer volume and flashy looks, which suits me just fine. You don't need to know what "acoustic suspension" means to appreciate the uncommonly deep, tight bass that radiates from this humble-looking cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Taibi

customer_reviews.title: Nice speaker for the price when it worked
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound for small rooms with materials played at a relatively low volume. I use mine with a Marantz 1403 and low-end Paradigm centers, fronts, and surrounds. It worked well with movies as well as music. That is, when it worked. The amp unit failed completely after 15 months of light use, which cost $350 to replace after two months of trying to contact SVS and/or find a local shop that would fix it when it became apparent SVS wasn't interested in my repeat business. It's a better value than most of the alternatives as long as you ignore reliability and repairs, but next go around I'm going to stick with a manufacturer that responds to inquiries for defective products.
customer_reviews.author: YOUR PUBLIC NAME

customer_reviews.title: It have been difficult to set it right. The ...
customer_reviews.text: It have been difficult to set it right. The documentation doesn't help much. I have found big differences in CDs so if I have it right in one the other has to much base and I don't think I have to Be playing around each time
customer_reviews.author: Jorge G.

product_meta.title: SVS SB-1000 Subwoofer (Black Ash) – 12-inch Driver, 300-Watts RMS, Sealed Cabinet
product_meta.description: Color:Black AshThe power and intensity of a world-class subwoofer from a compact 13-inch sealed cabinet design, the SVS SB-1000 subwoofer is small enough to conceal in any room yet powerful enough to energize a space with deep, effortless and articulate bass. High excursion 12-inch SVS driver and 300-watts RMS, 720-watts Peak power DSP amplifier set all performance benchmarks for a subwoofer of its size and price.
feature_bullets: High-excursion 12-inch driver delivers massive SPLs with detail and musicality.
300-watts RMS, 720-watts peak power SVS Sledge STA-300D DSP amplifier for effortless power and pinpoint control at all drive levels.
Rigidly braced, sonically inert and custom tuned sealed cabinet for pure, distortion-free bass, even at reference volume.

“Right out of the box, the SB-1000 astonished me with its depth and clarity...a listening experience that is coherent, cohesive, and musically engaging. I’m not sure there’s a better value today in audio.” -GoodSound.com

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars151 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
